body_html:
Can you describe more about your device and the sigsegv you're seeing?

Maybe not related to your issue, but Ndk 12b is suggested (12e does not exist afaik), as well as Bazel 0.4.2

Are you building with build_all_android.sh? That is the preferred way to build using the Makefile system.

Bazel is also a fully supported build method, e.g.:

bazel build -c opt tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib \
 --crosstool_top=//external:android/crosstool \
 --cpu=armeabi-v7a \
 --host_crosstool_top=@bazel_tools//tools/cpp:toolchain

body:
Can you describe more about your device and the sigsegv you're seeing?

Maybe not related to your issue, but Ndk 12b is suggested (12e does not exist afaik), as well as Bazel 0.4.2

Are you building with build_all_android.sh? That is the preferred way to build using the Makefile system.

Bazel is also a fully supported build method, e.g.:
```
bazel build -c opt tensorflow/core:android_tensorflow_lib \
 --crosstool_top=//external:android/crosstool \
 --cpu=armeabi-v7a \
 --host_crosstool_top=@bazel_tools//tools/cpp:toolchain
```
